name: Wintermute
tagline: The core of an artificial intelligence application framework.
body:
# Wintermute [![Stories in Ready](https://badge.waffle.io/jalcine/wintermute.png)](http://waffle.io/jalcine/wintermute) [![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/jalcine/wintermute/badge.png?branch=develop)](https://coveralls.io/r/jalcine/wintermute?branch=develop) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jalcine/wintermute.png)](https://travis-ci.org/jalcine/wintermute)

Wintermute is an extensible application that aims to become the foundation of 
an **artificial intelligence framework**. The application is written in C++ at 
its core but hopes are made to extend the platform to work with **Ruby**, 
**Python**, **JavaScript**, **Java**, **Scala**, **Lua**, **Haskell** and
**Go** (not in that exact order!). It'd be awesome!

## Installing

Installing? **Easy**. We use [CMake](http://cmake.org); we gotcha. But read
[INSTALL.md](./INSTALL.md) for more information.

## Tested Operating Systems
So far, Wintermute has only been built and tested on a Linux operating system,
more precisely, running [Kubuntu](http://kubuntu.org) Raring Ringtail 13.04.
Please build, test and upload your results for comparsion!

## Contributing

 - Fork, make a topic branch and propose your changes! **Bonus points for using Waffle**
 - Build and test Wintermute on a foreign, untested system!
 - Spread the word and do your part to make Wintermute an awesome app!

I *strongly* recommend using tools like
[`git-flow`](https://github.com/nvie/gitflow) and
[`git-hooks`](https://github.com/icefox/git-hooks) to accelerate your
development process.

Also, if you're adding a new feature, try writing a test
for it first!

## Support

I (the project maintainer, Jacky Alcine) do my best to answer any and all 
questions pertaining to Wintermute. You can e-mail me at me@jalcine.me or 
find me on IRC on Freenode, OFTC or the Perl servers with the nick
`jalcine` or `Jacky`.

## Licensing

Wintermute is licensed under the GPLv2 license. See `LICENSE` for more details.
